intro: Adenosepalum tomentosum, commonly known as the woolly adenosepalum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, tomentose stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
